title: Joy Villa and CeeLo Green lead Grammy Awards worst dressed with pro-Trump dress and bizarre gold outfit
text:

The 2017 awards season has been the most politically charged in recent history in the wake of Donald Trump's controversial first few weeks in office. 
But while many celebrities have voiced their opposition to the new US president, singer Joy Villa used the Grammys' red carpet to show her support. 
The 25-year-old made a strong political fashion statement, donning a red, white and blue dress emblazoned with Trump's campaign slogan 'Make America Great Again'. 
The mermaid gown also featured the billionaire's name in huge silver letters at the bottom. Joy Villa (Photo: Barcroft Media) Joy Villa (Photo: Splash News) 
The singer, who is not nominated for a Grammy Award, sparked fierce debate on social media. 
Some users flooded Twitter with praise for the singer's gutsy outfit choice. 
Others slammed the star for showing her support for the controversial president. Joy Villa (Photo: Splash News) 
On her Twitter bio, Villa describes herself as a feminist which came under fire given Trump's apparent views on women. 
Her Wikipedia page was also taken over soon after she walked the red carpet, with someone changing her stage name to 'Princess Trump'. (Photo: WireImage) 
Also vying for the night's worst dressed award was CeeLo Green who arrived wearing what can only be described as some sort of C3PO tribute outfit. (Photo: WireImage) 
The singer and rapper donned a head-to-toe gold outfit, complete with mask which made him look like a gold-encrusted Michael Myers from horror film Halloween. 
Also going for gold was Katy Perry, whose dress appeared to be having an identity crisis. (Photo: Getty Images North America) 
The singer looked sensational from the waist up, in a rose gold sequined number teamed with newly-blonde bed-head locks and fierce make-up. 
But the outfit was let down by the bottom half of her dress, which was a mass of ombre feathers which completely clashed with the top. (Photo: Rex Features) 
Grammy considered artist Girl Crush also hit a bum note as she turned up dressed as a giant ball pit.
